intro: Chamaefistula insularis, commonly known as the Socotra fig-pear, is a unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, spiny fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are alternate and have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. The Socotra fig-pear is also notable for its ornamental value and is considered a rare and endangered species.
